name: 80's Heavy Metal Quiz | Heavy Metal | 20 Questions

questions.text: What axeman replaced Yngwie Malmsteen in Alcatrazz for the band's 2nd album?
questions.explanation:
Steve Vai.

	Yngwie departed for Steeler and Vai stepped into his shoes for one album. He stay was short also, he left after one release.

questions.text: Ronnie James Dio and guitarist Craig Goldy have reunited for 2000's release 'Magica'. What 80's Dio album was Goldy featured on?
questions.explanation:
Dream Evil.

	Craig followed the departure of Vivian Campbell on the 1987 album 'Dream Evil'. Alas he left after just one album to try some solo work. Ronnie was able to lure him back in 2000 for his new concept album 'Magica'.

questions.text: What year did Pantera release their first album?
questions.explanation:
1983.

	Everyone knows Pantera was one of the 90's most exciting metal acts, but they actually got their start back in 1983. They didn't hit it big until 1990 and the addition of singer Phil Anselmo.

questions.text: What is the name of the hero in Queensryche's 'Operation Mindcrime'?
questions.explanation:
Nicky.

	Nicky is the down and out man that is used as a pawn by Doctor X.

questions.text: What band did famous keyboardist Gregg Giuffria form after the breakup of his self titled band?
questions.explanation:
House of Lords.

	After the lack of success attained by Guiffria Greg formed House of Lords. After three albums they went separate ways.

questions.text: Although this band has had a nice career for themselves, they are more famous for supplying Metallica with Kirk Hammett, who are they?
questions.explanation:
Exodus.

	Metallica owes Exodus big time, where would Metallica be after they dumped Dave Mustaine.

questions.text: Before donning the spandex for Ratt, what band did Juan Carlos Croucier play for?
questions.explanation:
Dokken.

	Juan played bass on Dokken's 'Breaking the Chains' before scurrying over to be on Ratt's self titled Ep the same year.

questions.text: Before Lenny Wolf formed Kingdom Come and landed the opening spot on the Monsters of Rock tour, what band was he in?
questions.explanation:
Stone Fury.

	Stone Fury featured Wolf and axeman Bruce Gowdy. They released two albums before breaking up.

questions.text: What band did current Anthrax lead singer John Bush front in the 80's and again in 2000?
questions.explanation:
Armored Saint.

	Bush released 5 albums with Armored Saint before switching coasts. He returned for the 2000 album for old time's sake.

questions.text: What band originally released 'Smoking In the Boys Room', which was covered by Motley Crue in 1985?
questions.explanation:
Brownsville Station.

	Brownsville Station released the hit in 1972.

questions.text: Who replaced the ousted Kevin Dubrow in Quiet Riot for one album in 1988?
questions.explanation:
Paul Shortino.

	Shortino left Rough Cutt to help his buds in Quiet Riot. Dubrow was back in the band by 1993.

questions.text: What guitarist replaced Randy Rhoads in Ozzy's band after Rhoad's untimely death?
questions.explanation:
Brad Gillis.

	Gillis filled the spot for the live album 'Speak of the Devil' He then left for Night Ranger and Jake E. Lee was ushered in.

questions.text: Who replaced the ousted Vinne Vincent in Kiss for 'Animalize'?
questions.explanation:
Mark St. John

	Mark lasted only one album, he was replaced on the 'Animalize' tour by Kulick.

questions.text: What was the last name of the three brothers in Mama's Boys?
questions.explanation:
McManus.

	McManus was the name of these british brothers.

questions.text: Who was the lead singer of Anthrax on 'Fistful of Metal'?
questions.explanation:
Neil Turbin.

	Neil belted out hits like 'Metal Thrashing Mad' before being shown the door, paving the way for Joey Belladonna.

questions.text: Guitar virtuoso David T. Chastain fronted two bands in the 80's at the same time. Can you name them?
questions.explanation:
Chastain and CJSS.

	While with his self titled band David also formed CJSS and released two albums in 1986.

questions.text: What were the last names of the 4 lead singers for Black Sabbath in the 80's?
questions.explanation:
Dio, Gillan, Hughes, and Martin.

	Black Sabbath tried many singers to replace the legendary Ozzy Osbourne, while fans continued to call for Ozzy's return.

questions.text: What band did Jake E. Lee form after his departure from Ozzy?
questions.explanation:
Badlands.

	Jake had success with Badlands for 2 albums before the death of singer Ray Gillen.

questions.text: What lead singer joined Yngwie Malmsteen in Steeler for the band's only release in 1983?
questions.explanation:
Ron Keel.

	Keel went on to form his self titled band after the his ego clashed with Malmsteen's.

questions.text: What band did Bruce Dickinson front before joining Iron Maiden?
questions.explanation:
Samson.

	Dickinson sang lead on a few Samson releases before leaving for the greener pastures of Iron Maiden.
